title: [Update] Lag and Disconnect Issue - 06/02/2015
body:
Summoners,

Over the past 5 days we have noticed an increase in players reconnecting to games and of course we have seen each Reddit and boards post that you have submitted.

The team had been investigating each day to try and determine the root cause of this issue and I am glad to say as of Thursday 13:00 we successfully diagnosed and completed a fix. To give some context of the fix, we had previously moved our game servers to new hardware to assist us with getting the most stable service to you. At that time everything appeared to be correct and working fine. However as you are aware an issue arose over the last few days causing the aforementioned lag and disconnects.

During our investigation we discovered a misconfiguration on the game servers, that could potentially lead to the increased Lag and Disconnects we have been seeing. After testing a configuration change on one game server, we were confident this could be the needle in the hay stack we were searching for. A plan was made and the fix was rolled out. The new configuration was in place and reconnects start going back to normal. For 24+ hours following the change we have seen a much more stable service and are happy with the change made.

As always we will continue to monitor the situation as players do sporadically have lag or disconnect from the game, so if you do experience lagging or disconnects please head over to our [Network Diagnostic Tool](http://oce.leagueoflegends.com/tools/network-logs) and complete all steps so we can look into possible solutions for you.

To be clear this issue is not related to the Firewall Error that some players have been experiencing. We are continuing to investigate that [here](http://boards.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/help-support-oce/WlGElu7g-update-firewall-error-after-champion-select).

We thank you for your patience and support during this time.

See you on the Fields of Justice.

-ToxicHawk

Hey there,

Just want clarify a few things. We have identified the sudden jump in firewall issues to be related to a few ISPs that NAT player's IPs behind a pool of public IPs. The way IP addresses are translated is causing connectivity issue to our game servers. 

We are trying to work with those ISPs to work around the issue, but unfortunately there are no clear solutions and require some collaboration between us and the problem ISP.

Which ISP are you with?

tl;dr This is not a capacity issue, and yes we are working on this.

Sorry you are having lagging issues, but it does take more than 1 or 2 leaves to get into the low priority queue.

That being said, as Cochese has mentioned above, we do want every player to have the best possible connection to League of Legends. We are aware that some ISP's are routing traffic to us sub-optimally, so we are talking with their engineers to try and improve the situation.

In order for us to continue doing this could you please head over to http://oce.leagueoflegends.com/tools/network-logs and complete the steps outlined. We can then check your connection details and use this information to help diagnose the issue.
